questions.question: Only two of the following text samples feature the past simple:

choices.answer: My grandfather died before I was born.
I've been thinking about what to wear for the party all day.
Nobody had found out about my secret.
While I was talking on the phone, my dog ran into my room.

questions.question: We use the past simple to talk about

choices.answer: what was going on at some point in the past.
what happened at a specific point in the past, e.g. in 2014.
what had happened before another point in the past.
states, likes, dislikes at a certain point in the past.

questions.question: Signal words for the past simple are

choices.answer: now, at the moment, right now.
in 2010, four weeks ago, last night.
always, usually, seldom, often.
back then, that day, last Tuesday.

questions.question: The important things about its verb forms are

choices.answer: to add '-ed' at the verb.
that there are about 180 irregular verbs, e.g. run-ran-run.
to use 'did' for questions and negation.
there is no 3rd person singular '-s', that's present only.
to lie (tell an untruth), to ask.
to lie (down, on your bed), to sing.
to think, to say.
to remember, to hear.

questions.question: Which of these sentences use the past simple?

choices.answer: Did you enjoy talking to her?
Had he applied for a job?
Her muffins tasted rather bad.
My dog looked as if someone had taken away his favorite toy.
She didn't answered me at all.
She not answered me at all.
She didn't answer me at all.
She wented home before me.

questions.question: 'I was waiting for the bus when Jamie texted me.'

choices.answer: The past simple describes the ongoing action.
The past simple describes the sudden, interrupting action.

questions.question: Another term for the past continuous is

choices.answer: past protruding.
past protracted.
past progressive.
past life choices.

questions.question: Only one of the following sentences features the past continuous:

choices.answer: When my girlfriend came into the room, I was busy cleaning.
Chris couldn't understand why people would ban guns.
My dog was pretty tired after running around the beach.
Sue was thinking about changing schools.

questions.question: We form the past continuous with

choices.answer: the past form of 'to be' and the 3rd form of the verb.
the present form of 'to be' and the -ing form of the verb.
the past form of 'to be' and the -ing form of the verb.
the past form of 'to be' and 'going to'.

questions.question: 'I was doing my homework when a comet crashed into the garden.'

choices.answer: The past continuous verb is the sudden, interrupting action.
The past continuous is the ongoing, interrupted action.

questions.question: We use the past continuous to say

choices.answer: what what was going on at some point in the past.
to talk about things in the past that are over.
what was going on when sth. else happened.
what was going on while sth. else was also going on.

questions.question: Signal words for the past continuous are

choices.answer: always reliable, e.g. after, before.
not always reliable, but when and while are good hints.
always reliable, e.g. now, at the moment.
always reliable, e.g. last Tuesday, in 2016.
He were dreaming about the holidays when the teach woke him.
The students were protesting while Donald was playing golf.
While I was play Clash of Clans, my phone died.
I was holding his hand when he fell asleep.

questions.question: Questions in the past continuous look like this:

choices.answer: Was he really thinking about his gf when he sold the house?
Wasn't the Mona Lisa painted by Picasso?
Weren't the dogs sleeping when the burglar broke in?
Weren't they at least disappointed about the match result?

questions.question: Tick the correct -ing forms of the following verbs:

choices.answer: to enter --> enterring
to begin --> beginning
to cry --> crying
to stare --> staring
